intro: Hieracium crepidispermum subsp. retropistum, commonly known as the backward-armed hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. This subspecies is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. It produces small, elongated achenes with pappus structures that aid in wind dispersal. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and is known for its distinctive leaf morphology.
